emails.subject: üíå Three Months Later: A Personal Note
emails.preview: From Dr. Chen: Why supporters like you matter more than grants

body: Three months ago, you donated to Dolphin Singularity.
I wanted to reach out personally to say thank you. And to share something I don't talk about often:
Grant cycles take 18 months. Review boards are risk-averse. Innovative ideas get rejected.
But direct supporters like you? You let us move fast. Try crazy things. Fail forward.
**In the last 3 months, YOUR donation helped us:**
‚Ä¢ Deploy experimental AI models (rejected by 3 grant committees)
‚Ä¢ Travel to remote locations on short notice
‚Ä¢ Purchase equipment without 6 months of paperwork
‚Ä¢ Hire talented researchers who don't fit traditional academia
We're 2 years ahead of schedule on dolphin communication research.
Peer-reviewed papers that typically take 5 years? We're publishing in 18 months.
One-time donations are incredible. But monthly supporters give us the stability to plan years ahead.
No pressure. Seriously. You've already done so much.
But if you believe in this mission as much as we do, monthly support is how we win.
Either way, thank you for taking this journey with us.
The dolphins thank you. (Well, they would if we could translate it yet. We're working on it.)
P.S. Hit reply - I personally read every message from supporters. Would love to hear what brought you to our mission.
